title: Kernel Hacking
description:
Write a simple kernel driver, debug and trace it remotely with gdb.
In this hands-on workshop, you have a chance to learn some cool tricks working with Linux kernel code. The Linux kernel allows you to debug kernel code running on a remote system with a different architecture, just like you would debug a program running in userspace. A powerful trace infrastructure makes it easier to spot issues in time-sensitive systems, when setting a breakpoint is not an option.
